snippet: The Obama administration has informed lawmakers that the president will seek an authorization that would prohibit “enduring offensive ground forces” and limit engagement to three years.
abstract: Pres Obama will seek formal authorization from Congress to fight Islamic State that would not permit 'enduring offensive ground forces' and limit action to three years; request is expected to start long debate over presidential war powers and committing to another volatile Middle East mission.

byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has informed lawmakers that the president will seek an authorization that would prohibit “enduring offensive ground forces” and limit engagement to three years.

headline.main: Obama to Seek War Power Bill From Congress, to Fight ISIS
headline.print_headline: Obama Is to Seek War Power Bill From Congress

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
